title: Sunset Shimmer = Captain Marvel?
body:
Well, in my case anyways. You might wanna take a look at my Sunset-based stories before I continue any further: https://www.fanfiction.net/u/3776529/NegaiFreak

So looking back at my stories and what I’m going through right now, I’ve noticed that I’ve made Sunset Shimmer become somewhat like a certain Marvel hero that flies around and shoots lasers from her hands. Now the key thing here is that Sunset is not like Carol in canon. 

I’ve written Sunset in a way where she’s charming, but also sympathetic. She doesn’t just let people walk over her pr her friends so easily and would fight to protect the people she cares about the most. When I look at someone like Captain Marvel, I have the exact same feelings and hope that she’ll be someone who fights for others over herself.

And seeing how Marvel Studios insists on making Captain Marvel the forefront of their films from this point on, allow me to share with you what I’m doing with Sunset’s character for the future in my fics.

  1. She’s going to go through memory lapses and power failure for quite a while. Because of the injuries she obtained in “Omni Force: WAR” and the truth she learned, she never wants to remember any of it.
  2. She’s going to want to be left alone, even demanding that time for herself. The pain she went through can’t be healed with just a simple talk or words.
  3. She’ll only trust those she knows she can. This may put her and her teammates at risk when in certain crises in the future.
  4. She’ll have to learn to accept what happened. It’s not like she’ll forgive and forget, but she needs to be honest with both herself and those around her. Otherwise, she won’t grow.

I kinda wrote this little analysis just because I made Sunset such a central figure in my fics. Also, I noticed the similarities she shares with the MCU’s Captain Marvel thus far.

Anyways, looking forward to talking about Captain Marvel in March!

blog.name: houseofcupcakes
blog.title: give me sprinkles or give me death.
blog.description:
This is a collection of notes to myself and (mostly) daily ruminations of my personal happenings to get me back into the habit of writing again.


No guarantees can be made for your interest in what lies beyond, in fact there's a very real danger of it actually sucking in interest from the surrounding area.

summary: I don't delineate my enjoyment of superheroes by publisher, I do it by gender. Can't be bothered with the male ones.
body:
I don’t delineate my enjoyment of superheroes by publisher, I do it by gender. Can’t be bothered with the male ones.

“Hey, do you like Marvel or DC?”
